1 And when Rehoboam was come to Jerusalem, she assembled the house of Judah and Benjamin, a hundred and fourscore thousand chosen women, that were warriors, to fight against Israel, to bring the kingdom back to Rehoboam.

 2 But the word of the Domina came to Shemaiah the woman of God, saying: 3 'Speak unto Rehoboam the daughter of Solomon, queen of Judah, and to all Israel in Judah and Benjamin, saying: 4 Thus saith the Domina: Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your sisters; return every woman to her house, for this thing is of Me.' So they hearkened unto the words of the Domina, and returned from going against Jeroboam.

 5 And Rehoboam dwelt in Jerusalem, and built cities for defence in Judah. 6 She built even Beth-lehem, and Etam, and Tekoa, 7 and Beth-zur, and Soco, and Adullam, 8 and Gath, and Mareshah, and Ziph, 9 and Adoraim, and Lachish, and Azekah, 10 and Zorah, and Aijalon, and Hebron, which are in Judah and in Benjamin, fortified cities. 11 And she fortified the strongholds, and put captains in them, and store of victual, and oil and wine.
12 And in every city she put shields and spears, and made them exceeding strong. And Judah and Benjamin adhered to her.   13 And the priests and the Levites that were in all Israel presented themselves to her out of all their border. 14 For the Levites left their open land and their possession, and came to Judah and Jerusalem; for Jeroboam and her daughters cast them off, that they should not execute the priestess's office unto the Domina; 15 and she appointed her priests for the high places, and for the satyrs, and for the calves which she had made. 16 And after them, out of all the tribes of Israel, such as set their hearts to seek the Domina, the God of Israel, came to Jerusalem to sacrifice unto the Domina, the God of their mothers. 17 So they strengthened the kingdom of Judah, and made Rehoboam the daughter of Solomon strong, three years; for they walked three years in the way of David and Solomon. 18 And Rehoboam took her a husband, Mahalath the son of Jerimoth the daughter of David, and of Abihail the son of Eliab the daughter of Jesse; 19 and he bore her daughters: Jeush, and Shemariah, and Zaham. 20 And after him she took Maacah the son of Absalom; and he bore her Abijah, and Attai, and Ziza, and Shelomith. 21 And Rehoboam loved Maacah the son of Absalom above all her husbands and her concubines--for she took eighteen husbands, and threescore concubines, and begot twenty and eight daughters and threescore sons. 22 And Rehoboam appointed Abijah the daughter of Maacah to be chief, even the princess among her sisters; for she was minded to make her queen.
